smartblocks.shapes
Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  smartblocks.shapes.Box
      smartblocks.shapes.Circle
          smartblocks.shapes.Polygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
Shape
public class Polygon
extends Circle

A polygon enclosed in a Circle and with a Box as bounds

Author:
David FUENMAYOR

Constructor Detail

Polygon

public Polygon(Vector2D offset,
               Vector2D[] v)
Create a new polygon. The actual offset and vertices of the polygon are calculated so it behaves as a circle whose center is: offset + vertices' centroid and radius is the radius of the vertices' bounding circle

Parameters:
offset -
v -

computeArea

protected final float computeArea()
Computes the area as described by Paul Borke.

Returns:
this polygon's computed area
See Also:
http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/polyarea/}

computeCentroid

protected final Vector2D computeCentroid()
Compute the centroid (center of mass) as described by Paul Borke.

Returns:
the computed centroid
See Also:
http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/polyarea/} Make sure you have computed the area before calling this!

computeBoundingCircleRadius

protected final float computeBoundingCircleRadius()
Computes the radius of an approximation of a minimal bounding circle which has its origin at the centroid.

Returns:
radius of the circle in which this polygon is circumscribed

isConvex

public boolean isConvex()
Check whether or not the polygon is convex.

Returns:
true if this polygon is convex

getVertices

public Vector2D[] getVertices(boolean absolute)
Returns a copy of the polygon's vertices with respect to this shape's centroid

Specified by:
getVertices in interface Shape
Overrides:
getVertices in class Box
Parameters:
absolute - if true applies transformations, rotation and then translation
Returns:
array of vertices, expressed with respect to this shape's centroid
